Alassane Ouattara , who the world recognises as the rightful winner of November's presidential election.Meanwhile, the UN Refugee Agency( UNHCR) said it was calling on governments to suspend all returns of asylum seekers to Ivory Coast, pending improvements in the security and human rights situation.`` Since the elections`` abductions, disappearances, extra-judicial executions and acts of sexual violence have been reported in Abidjan and elsewhere, said UNHCR spokesman Andrej Mahecic.Some 18,000 people are internally displaced in href="http://www.earthtimes.org/tag/Ivory-Coast.html"> Ivory Coast and neighbouring Liberia is href="http://www.earthtimes.org/tag/hosting.html"> hosting about 30,000 refugees.

staff to search children for any material that may disrupt lessons feature in the Bill, while rules forcing schools to give parents 24 hours notice of a detention will also be scrapped. Mr Michael Gove said: This Michael Government backs teachers. All the evidence from those countries with great education systems tells us that nothing is more important than attracting great people into teaching and supporting them in the classroom.`` Teachers will be free to impose the penalties they need to keep order and free from the red tape which swallows up teaching time, so they can get on with their first duty- raising standards. Plans to axe a number of education quangos will feature in the bill, as will the legislation required to allow Michael Government to charge university students higher rates of interest on tuition fee loans.
